title: Fox has quietly implemented its own version of a vaccine passport while its top personalities attack them
description: Tucker Carlson has called the idea of vaccine passports the medical equivalent of "Jim Crow" laws. And other Fox News personalities have spent months both trafficking in anti-vaccine rhetoric  and assailing the concept of showing proof of vaccination status.

title: Ben & Jerry's will stop selling ice cream in Palestinian territories
description: Ben & Jerry's will no longer sell ice cream in occupied Palestinian territories, saying it's inconsistent with the values of the socially conscious brand.

title: Dow sinks as Delta variant fears hit Wall Street hard
description: Investors are getting spooked by the rising numbers of Covid-19 cases as the Delta variant spreads across the globe.

title: US won't commit to reopening northern border despite Canada welcoming Americans
London mayor's biggest problem with eased Covid-19 restrictions
description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan talks with CNN's Christiane Amanpour as England decides to lift most covid-19 restrictions.

title: First US Capitol rioter convicted of a felony gets 8 months in prison
description: A man who pleaded guilty to breaching the Senate chamber during the US Capitol insurrection was sentenced Monday to eight months in prison in a closely watched case that could influence how hundreds of other rioters charged with the same felony are punished.

title: Prince Harry is publishing a memoir
description: Prince Harry, one of the most talked-about figures in the world, is publishing a memoir next year that he calls "wholly truthful."

title: Megan Thee Stallion unveiled as Sports Illustrated cover star
description: "Hot Girl Summer" is now complete, as Megan Thee Stallion becomes the first rapper to appear on the cover of the Sports Illustrated's Swimsuit issue.

title: US transfers Guantánamo Bay detainee to home country of Morocco
description: A Moroccan man held in Guantánamo Bay for nearly 20 years has been transferred from the US detention facility to his native country of Morocco, the Department of Defense announced Monday, in what is believed to be the first transfer of a detainee in the Biden administration.

title: NASA helicopter spies intriguing features on Mars during record-breaking flight
description: During a recent daring Martian flight by the Ingenuity helicopter July 5, the chopper acted like an aerial scout for the Perseverance rover as it sailed over rough but intriguing terrain.

title: NHL prospect Luke Prokop comes out as gay, in a first for the league
description: National Hockey League prospect Luke Prokop came out as gay via a heartfelt statement to fans Monday, saying he hoped it would improve gay visibility within the hockey community.

title: Paralympian angered after official said her sprint briefs were 'too short'
description: Double Paralympic world champion Olivia Breen says she was left "speechless" after an official at the English Championships told her that her sprint briefs were "too short and inappropriate."

title: CCTV footage shows family narrowly escaping mudslide
description: Turkish state media says the family living in the house is safe and managed to flee just before the mudslide hit.

title: US and allies blame China for hacks, including massive Microsoft email breach
description: The United States and its foreign allies plan Monday to accuse China of overseeing widespread attempts to extort money in cyberspace, including through ransomware attacks, a dramatic escalation in the increasingly urgent attempt by the Biden administration to stave off further breaches.

title: Why Matt Damon's daughter won't watch 'Good Will Hunting'
description: Matt Damon appeared on "CBS Sunday Morning" to promote the new film "Stillwater", and shared how his family keeps him humble.

title: Matt Damon's teen daughter is one of his biggest critics
description: Matt Damon's teenage daughter refuses to watch any of his movies that might show off his acting ability, he says.

title: Mark Spitz: Seven ways to survive the Olympic Games
description: A nine-time gold medalist, Mark Spitz knows a thing or two about how to successfully navigate the Olympic Games as an athlete.

title: See mesmerizing images of Jupiter and its biggest moon
description: NASA has released an animation that allows viewers to get a​ simulated "starship captain" eye ​view of its flyby of Jupiter and its ​largest moon, Ganymede.

title: Haiti's acting prime minister to step down amid power struggle after president's assassination
description: Haiti's acting prime minister Claude Joseph, who has led the country since the assassination of president Jovenel Moise earlier this month, will step down and hand power to Ariel Henry, the elections minister told CNN on Monday.

title: Deadly floods inundated parts of Europe, but the Netherlands avoided fatalities. Here's why
description: As communities devastated by the catastrophic flooding in parts of western Europe start picking up the pieces, they are wondering how it all went so wrong, so fast. After all, Europe has a world-leading warning system that issued regular alerts for days before floods engulfed entire villages.

title: Coffee won't make your heart flutter, study says
description: Worried that coffee will make your heart go pitter-patter, and not in a good way? A new study puts to rest the fear that your daily fuel will cause heart palpitations -- or cardiac arrhythmia, as doctors call it.

title: Three women said they found out they had the same cheating boyfriend, so they converted a school bus and went on a road trip
description: Bekah King, Abi Roberts, and Morgan Tabor have a lot in common. They describe themselves as free spirited adventurers and fearless risk takers, all obsessed with music and the movie "Megamind."

title: Missing dog was trapped behind a wall for 5 days. Then a neighbor heard whining
description: The Cincinnati Fire Department broke through a wall to free a dog that had been missing and trapped in a small space for five days.

title: CNN announces CNN+, 'most important launch for network since Ted Turner'
description: CNN is hiring hundreds of people and developing dozens of programs for a subscription streaming service that will launch early next year.

title: 10 luxury hotel rooms where you can sleep in the great outdoors
description: Our fear of being indoors has considerably abated since last year, but it's always magical to spend a night sleeping outside.

title: Illegal gold miners threaten fragile way of life, deep in Amazon rainforest
description: Deep in the Amazon rainforest, the Yanomami people are battling an old and elusive enemy -- one they haven't seen since the 1980s.

title: Lewis Hamilton targeted with racist abuse online after controversial British Grand Prix victory
description: Lewis Hamilton was the target of online racist abuse after winning his eighth British Grand Prix on Sunday.

title: Cartoonist whose depiction of Mohammed sparked outrage dies at 86
description: Danish cartoonist Kurt Westergaard, whose depiction of the prophet Mohammed wearing a turban made out of a bomb sparked a wave of violence in 2006, has died at the age of 86.

title: Bruce Springsteen's manager ends 'Thunder Road' lyric debate
description: We finally know what Mary's dress does.

title: The Hubble Space Telescope is functioning again after more than month offline
description: The Hubble Space Telescope is functioning again after more than a month offline as a result of a problem with the payload computer on board.

title: 'This is a complete catastrophe': UN official on Covid in Myanmar
description: February's military coup in Myanmar upended the country's healthcare system, which is now on the brink of collapse as Covid-19 cases climb. One third of all people tested in Myanmar are testing positive for the virus, but as one protester tells CNN, vaccinations have faltered as citizens refuse to cooperate with military authorities. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

title: Robinhood aims for $35 billion price tag in blockbuster IPO
description: Robinhood could soon be worth $35 billion.

title: How to watch Jeff Bezos go to space
description: Jeff Bezos, the world's richest man, is about to launch himself on a supersonic joyride to the edge of space.

title: Gymnast jumps on Olympic Village cardboard bed to debunk 'anti-sex fake news'
description: Athletes have been settling into their new accommodation at the Olympic Village as they prepare for the Tokyo Games -- and testing out what's on offer, notably their beds and food.

title: Toyota won't run Olympics ads and its CEO won't attend the opening ceremony
description: Toyota will have a subdued role at the Olympics in Japan this year, despite being one of the event's biggest sponsors.

title: Zoom buys Five9 in $14.7 billion deal to prepare for a post-pandemic world
description: Zoom, the video-conferencing platform that became hugely popular during the Covid-19 pandemic, is spending a whopping $14.7 billion on cloud-based software company Five9 to boost its appeal with business clients.

title: Olympic leaders urged to lift ban on swim cap for natural Black hair
description: An anti-racist group of members of the European Parliament have accused the global sports community, including the International Olympic Committee (IOC), of having "institutional structures and rules that exclude people of colour and Black women specifically."

title: What you need to know before you board an airplane right now
description: While our suitcases have been gathering dust over the past 16 months, the travel industry has been rapidly adapting to cope with the demands of the new Covid era.

title: Researchers identify 14 living descendants of Leonardo da Vinci's family
description: Decades-long research into Leonardo da Vinci's purported remains has revealed how many people currently alive can claim to be descendants of the family of the Renaissance genius and "Mona Lisa" painter: It's 14.

title: Feeling anxiety about your body image coming out of lockdown? Here are 8 ways to combat it
description: Being able to socialize again may bring enthusiasm and a sense of normalcy -- but it may also increase anxiety over how your body might have changed.

title: At least 31 people killed after Mumbai hit with torrential rain
description: At least 31 people were killed when torrential rain swept through India's financial capital late on Sunday, triggering landslides that crushed cars and houses while leaving neighborhoods devastated.

title: Australia to deport right-wing British columnist after quarantine breach
description: Australia will deport controversial right-wing British commentator Katie Hopkins after she admitted breaching the country's quarantine rules, Australia's minister for home affairs said on Monday.

title: Americans sentenced to prison for helping Carlos Ghosn flee Japan
description: A Tokyo court on Monday sentenced United States Army Special Forces veteran Michael Taylor to two years in prison and his son to one year and eight months for helping former Nissan Motor Company chairman Carlos Ghosn flee Japan, where he had faced charges of financial misconduct.

title: China's already spending billions on overseas investments. Does it need to fund security, too?
description: The death of nine Chinese workers in a bus explosion in Pakistan has underscored the security risks attached to China's overseas projects, as anti-China sentiment simmers in countries where official ties with Beijing are strong.

title: 'Law & Order: SVU' actor charged with murder in 'brazen afternoon shooting'
